law.catch_line: Powers of Attorney General -- Powers of Commonwealth or its agencies not limited.

text.section: All of the remedies and powers granted to the Attorney General by KRS 367.190 to 367.300 and 367.990 for enforcement of KRS 367.170 shall be granted to the Attorney General with equal force and effect for enforcement of KRS 367.832.

Nothing in this chapter limits the power of any agency of the Commonwealth of Kentucky to enforce criminal or civil provisions of any other chapter of the Kentucky Revised Statutes or the right of any person to bring civil actions granted by any other chapter of the Kentucky Revised Statutes and based upon conduct prohibited herein and nothing in this chapter limits the power of the Commonwealth of Kentucky to punish any person for any conduct which constitutes a crime by statute or at common law.

law.history: Created 1986 Ky. Acts ch. 184, sec. 3, effective July 15, 1986.
